N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 36.3 - Definitions

State Regulations

For the purposes of this Part, the following definitions
apply: (a) Industrial access project
(project). Project for the design, acquisition of property, construction and/or
reconstruction of existing and/or newly located public access roads, streets
and bridges, curbing, sidewalks, lighting systems, traffic control and safety
devices, drainage systems and culverts as they pertain to industrial access
needs and any other highway- or bridge-related work. (b) Public benefit corporation. Corporation
organized to construct or operate a public improvement wholly or partly within
the State, profits to inure to either this or another state. (c) State agency. An office, department, board, commission, bureau, division, public corporation, agency or
instrumentality of the State. (d) Industrial facility. Any type of facility to be used or occupied by any person
in an enterprise deemed to offer a reasonable likelihood for promoting the
creation or retention of job opportunities in the State; and includes, but is
not limited to manufacturing plants; facilities for research and development
purposes; facilities for conducting wholesale, receiving and distributing
operations; facilities for conducting warehousing operations, agricultural
operations, or any other operation dealing in the exchange of goods, wares, services or other types of property of any type or description. Facilities
supporting primarily commercial retail operations are not defined as industrial
facilities. (e) Proposal. A written
description of the project intended to receive Industrial Access Program
funding which generally follows the outline given in section
36.6
(b) of this

Part, and which is submitted to the Regional Director of Transportation for the
area in which the proposed project is to be located, and is intended for
consideration by the New York State Department of Transportation for receipt of
industrial access project funds. (f) Sponsor. A State agency, county, city, town, village, industrial development agency, or public benefit corporation, which submits a proposal for Industrial Access Program funding and which is
willing to enter into legal agreements with the State of New York for the
execution of the project and repayment required by law. Notes
